derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from late Latin extortio(n-), from Latin extorquere 'wrest' (see extort)

entry.def: Extortion is the crime of obtaining something from someone, especially money, by using force or threats.

example.ex: He has been charged with extortion and abusing his powers.
example.tran: 他被控犯有敲诈勒索罪和滥用职权罪。

means.word_mean: 2. unjust exaction (as by the misuse of authority);

sentences.sentence: "the extortion by dishonest officials of fees for performing their sworn duty"

means.word_mean: 3. the felonious act of extorting money (as by threats of violence)

sentences.en: He was known for running a brutal extortion racket.
sentences.cn: 他因干过一起残忍的敲诈勒索而出名。

sentences.en: When my children say they will leave me in peace if I let them go to the pictures,it is little short of extortion.
sentences.cn: 我的孩子们说,除非我让他们去看电影,否则不让我安宁,这和敲诈勒索没什么两样。
